intro: Aspidopterys yemensis, commonly known as the Yemen aspidopterys, is a rare and endemic species native to Yemen. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within mountainous regions, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soil. Aspidopterys yemensis is notable for its small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring, adding to its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
